column4: *does a better torrent client exist than ktorrent?*  (I'm starting to wonder if a switch to KDE would make sense considering I'm starting to find that apps like KTorrent, Amarok, and K3b are unbeatable)
azureus? if you have the memory and resources
sorry, no java apps allowed on my machine unless it's the only option
utorrent through wine? =)
have you personally used utorrent on wine?
nope.. I've used it when I had windows on the box.. and I've seen screenshots and such.. apparently it works
I use azureus myself
I'm wondering if i should download the standalone program, or the installation version of utorrent?  the standalone version doesn't quite work
I don't think there is much of a difference
get the standalone version.. it's only a small exe file.. I think you can run it in install-mode to make it create shortcuts and such
i tried, but all I can see is the window border/frame
what version of wine? I'll give it a try
works here.. on wine 9.31
I don't get it...there's no real configuration for wine is there??
there's winecfg.. but that's about it
but try updating.. 0.9.30 was a bit dodgy
hah...i'm not sure if it was the new version of wine...but i just realized that uTorrent startes minimized, that's why i couldn't see it!!  wine's pretty sweet
hehe.. nice.. so.. you have a small, nice torrent client =)
I'll prolly end up sticking with ktorrent...but it's nice that i know wine works!  if i wanted to launch utorrent, the launch command would be "wine /opt/utorrent.exe"???
yup. that sounds right
I think he left.. well well.. he'll be back I suppose =)
I think that's what "sudo apt-get install" does.. not sure though but try it
